definitions.definition: ( transitive ) To cause an increase in temperature of (an object or space); to cause to become hot ( often with "up" ) .

examples: There's a pot of soup heating on the stove.

definitions.definition: ( transitive , figurative ) To excite or make hot by action or emotion; to make feverish.
( transitive , figurative ) To excite ardour in; to rouse to action; to excite to excess; to inflame, as the passions.
( transitive , slang ) To arouse , to excite (sexually).

main_definition: ( transitive ) To cause an increase in temperature of (an object or space); to cause to become hot ( often with "up" ) .

( transitive , slang ) To arouse , to excite (sexually).

definitions.definition: simple past and past participle of heat

main_definition: ( dialectal or obsolete ) simple past and past participle of heat
